intro: Senecio tanacetopsis, commonly known as the blue-eyed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that resemble daisies. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers. Senecio tanacetopsis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
